definition: there is still time (to do sth)/to be able to do sth in time/to be able to make it
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
and/to reach/up to/in time for

sentences.english: Make haste, and you'll be in time for class.
sentences.chinese: 动做快一点，你才赶得及上课。

sentences.english: Will our young hero be ready in time?
sentences.chinese: 我们的小英雄能赶得及做好战斗的准备吗？

sentences.english: If you want to arrive in time for lunch, you'd better get a move on.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想赶得及到那儿吃午餐，最好快点动身。

sentences.english: I want this letter to catch the afternoon mail .
sentences.chinese: 我想让这封信赶得及能随下午收取的邮件走。

sentences.english: He had to take a taxi and hoped to catch the start of the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 小职员唯有改乘出租车，希望能赶得及参加会议。

definition: not enough time (to do sth)/too late (to do sth)
to go on a journey/to leave
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
to set out/to leave
late
tomorrow morning/tomorrow
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
variant of 耽擱|耽搁[dan1 ge5]
there's still time/able to do sth in time
breakfast
by the way/while out doing sth else/conveniently
to go on an errand for nothing/to go on a wild-goose chase
to come early/already/early
safe and sound (idiom)
by chance/by coincidence/by good luck
erhua variant of 快點|快点[kuai4 dian3]
